content.raw: Even though `_sdf` is passed by const ref, the objected pointed to by `_sdf` is still modifiable. I tried calling `_sdf->ClearElements()` and it compiled just fine. I suggest passing a `std::shared_ptr<const Element>` instead.
content.html: Even though _sdf is passed by const ref, the objected pointed to by _sdf is still modifiable. I tried calling _sdf->ClearElements() and it compiled just fine. I suggest passing a std::shared_ptr<const Element> instead.

update.description:
Introduces an Init method to the system api, that allows systems to get the relevant SDF information from the <plugin> tag.

Introduces ISystemConfigure, an interface for a system to create initial entities, as well as subscribe to events from the EventManager.
update.title: Create an EventManager to be used on a per SimulationRunner basis.

content.raw: Yes, you would need to get a pointer.  I was initially passing in a raw pointer and could switch back to that. I don't know that a `shared_ptr` makes sense here, because a system should not share ownership of the EventManager \(both the System and the EventManager are owned by the SimulationRunner\)
content.html: Yes, you would need to get a pointer. I was initially passing in a raw pointer and could switch back to that. I don't know that a shared_ptr makes sense here, because a system should not share ownership of the EventManager (both the System and the EventManager are owned by the SimulationRunner)

pullrequest.title: Create an EventManager to be used on a per SimulationRunner basis.

content.raw:
The newest commit delegates the instantiation of `System` objects to the `SimulationRunner` by passing in a reference to `SystemManager`

This allows for a smaller `System` API that consists only of an optional `Configure(sdf::ElementPtr, EntityComponentManager, EventManager)`.  This will also replace the follow-on `Runnable` PR, because threads could be spawned here as well.
content.html:
The newest commit delegates the instantiation of System objects to the SimulationRunner by passing in a reference to SystemManager

This allows for a smaller System API that consists only of an optional Configure(sdf::ElementPtr, EntityComponentManager, EventManager). This will also replace the follow-on Runnable PR, because threads could be spawned here as well.

update.description:
Introduces an Init method to the system api, that allows systems to get the relevant SDF information from the <plugin> tag.

Introduces ISystemConfigure, an interface for a system to create initial entities, as well as subscribe to events from the EventManager.

pull_request.title: Create an EventManager to be used on a per SimulationRunner basis.

pullrequest.title: Create an EventManager to be used on a per SimulationRunner basis.

content.raw:
So we may not need both, but I wanted to provide a quick context as to why both exist.

In this case, `Init` is called after the constructor \(in [ServerPrivate.cc](http://ServerPrivate.cc)\). The Plugin loader will actually call the constructor, this is to provide the additional SDF data that the plugin may need for initialization \(or configuration?\)

`Configure` is called once the System has been given to the SimulationRunner, and provides an opportunity for the system to add additional entities or components as needed, as well as register for events.

I think that the names could be easily switched, but they could potentially be condensed by reading the SDF inside the simulationrunner.  I’ll take a look.
content.html:
So we may not need both, but I wanted to provide a quick context as to why both exist.

In this case, Init is called after the constructor (in ServerPrivate.cc). The Plugin loader will actually call the constructor, this is to provide the additional SDF data that the plugin may need for initialization (or configuration?)

Configure is called once the System has been given to the SimulationRunner, and provides an opportunity for the system to add additional entities or components as needed, as well as register for events.

I think that the names could be easily switched, but they could potentially be condensed by reading the SDF inside the simulationrunner. I’ll take a look.

pullrequest.title: Create an EventManager to be used on a per SimulationRunner basis.

content.raw:
The name `Init` might be confusing. To me, the name 'Init' indicates that the function can be called multiple times, mostly commonly when a well know initial state needs to be established. 

After looking at this, you might want to swap 'Configure'  and 'Init'. So, `Configure` is called after construction and `Init` is called when it's added to the simulation runner. 

What do you think @chapulina and @carromj ?
content.html:
The name Init might be confusing. To me, the name 'Init' indicates that the function can be called multiple times, mostly commonly when a well know initial state needs to be established.

After looking at this, you might want to swap 'Configure' and 'Init'. So, Configure is called after construction and Init is called when it's added to the simulation runner.

What do you think @chapulina and @carromj ?
